item.title: Emily add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "A beautiful day with the buoyancy of a bird." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Emily add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Even the stove and the refrigerator looked human, I mean good human - they seemed to have arms and voices and they said, hang around, kid, it's good here, it can be very good here." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Emily add a quote by Paul Harding
item.description: "Howard, instead of trying to explain the hermit's existence in terms of hearth fires and trappers' shacks, preferred the blank space the old man actually seemed to inhabit; he liked to think of some fold in the woods, some seam that only the hermit could sense and slip into, where the ice and snow, where the frozen forest itself, would accept him and he would no longer need fire or wool blankets, but instead flourish wreathed in snow, spun in frost, with limbs like cold wood and blood like frigid sap." -- Paul Harding

item.title: Emily add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The really important kind of freedom involves attention, and awareness, and discipline, and effort, and being able truly to care about other people and to sacrifice for them, over and over, in myriad petty little unsexy ways, every day." -- David Foster Wallace
